definition:
Let $k$ be a field. Then $k^*$, the multiplicative group of $k$ is an
affine algebraic group over $k$. An affine algebraic group of the form
$(k^*)^n$ is called an [*algebraic torus*]{} over $k$.

The name is to the fact that if $k={\mathbb{C}}$, then an algebraic
torus is the complexification of the standard torus $(S^1)^n$.
